Portal 2 is probably one of my all time favorite games. Fun, simple to understand, you can play it over and over, and the accomplishments aren't impossible. Everyone should play Portal and Portal 2.

Uma grande experiência coop. Em comparação com o primeiro, o 2 me rendeu a mesma diversão, com adição de gráficos, novos desafios, novas estruturas, novas mecânicas e o velho e bom multiplayer. Ou seja, é uma evolução que traz adições fundamentais e excelentes. 

Em resumo, se você gosta de jogar algo que é complexo e casual ao mesmo tempo, e mais, gosta da ideia de jogar isso com um amigo, esse é o jogo.

A game that needs no introduction, and dispenses an actual review. But that's just me. 
A great and brilliant game, lots of fun and witty humour (some dark as well) and a great sequel to the first Portal. If you loved the first one you will absolutely love this one as well. Both story and gameplay are well developed and the inclusion of community made content is a plus giving near infinite gameplay hours. 

Co-op mode is a good feature enabling you and a friend to explore the portal mechanics numerous possibilities whilst keeping in mind the original storyline. Once again the community created content is a key feature, although both singleplayer campaign and co-op campaigns are well endowed to keep you exploring the world for eater eggs and alike. 

Quite frankly there doesn't come to mind negative aspects, some minor bugs tha need fixing and are well discussed in the community boards. Paying for customization elements for the co-op players is probably my only downer since there could be more unlockable content. Either way that's just nitpicking. 

To me it was one of those games that had an impact on my life and was a major influence. And the people who know me also know that's a rare thing for a game to do.

10/10
Cool as hell!

This Game made my mind explode after tying itself in 1,000,000,000,000 knots, un tying itself, retying it, and punching itself. It also got me out of depression. SPAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Pokračování známé logické hry z dílny Valve. Opět dostáváte s protagonistkou z prvního dílu do rukou Portal Gun a řešíte logické hádanky. Ke staré známé GLaDOS přibyl nový robot, Wheatley. Oba dva roboti vás budou provázet celou hrou a jejich komentáře vás rozhodně pobaví. Také přibyly nové herní systémy, např. lasery, jejichž paprsky budete lámat sklem, či tekutiny různých barev, které budete rozstřikovat po okolí a budete díky nim mít bonusy k rychlosti, k délce skoku a podobně. Hrací doba je mnohem delší, než byla u prvního dílu. Konečně. Dále je hra propojená se Steam Workshopem, takže stahování nových map je extrémně jednoduché. Také řešení hádanek bývá v porovnání s prvním dílem obtížnější. Hlavní příběh je v podstatě extrémně jednoduchý, ale díky vtipnosti GLaDOS a Wheatleyho ho budete se zájmem sledovat. Grafické zpracování je pěkné, alespoň na to, že se jedná o logickou hru. Na závěr je třeba zmínit nově přidaný co-op mod, který určitě potěší tu extrovertnější část hráčů.
[i]
+ zábavný systém řešení logických hádanek
+ vtipné hlavní "postavy"
+ dlouhá herní doba (aspoň v porovnání s jedničkou)
+ co-op

- ani mě nic nenapadá. Možná časté nahrávání mapy
[/i]

A tal punto que lo volveré a comprar para jugar en el modo cooperativo con mi hijo.

Simply the best Valve game. It took the brilliance and innovation of Portal and formed it into an actual full fledged title. Proof that Valve still dominates PC gaming and knows how to bring the public high quality titles.

Try it. Ignore the childish naysayers on here and just bloody try it. You will love every second of it, especially if you loved the first Portal. And if you've not played the first Portal, don't let that deter you. The game stands up on its own perfectly well, and I'm sure it'll be seen from now on as the benchmark for all games that fall within its genre.

I don't even like puzzle games, but Portal 2 was probably one of the best experiences I've had in ANY game I've ever played.

This game is simply amazing. Any fans of video games in general need to play this. 

It has a great story, with quite the interesting twist, and very lovable characters.
It's puzzles are wonderful. They never felt too hard, nor too easy. All of them are fun throughout their entirety and always leave you feeling like a mastermind once you complete them.
The humor was fantastic. This game is filled to the brim with quality intelligent humor that never, ever got old or predictable.
And finally, the gameplay was solid gold. The use of portals to achieve goals, while sounding simple, is used in many creative ways that make this game truly one-of-a-kind.

10/10. It deserves all of the praise it's getting.

And, of course, being able to look through and travel trough portals is mind-blowing every time it's used.

Review based on single player mode only, in 2014.
With a metascore of 95, this is certainly one of the most overrated game. The game is not bad but had several issues.
Actually in most areas I would give the game a 7/10. I don't see any one single aspect that I would rate at 9.

- Technically the game is OK, the 3D 'Source' engine is serviceable but a bit dated. Most items and environments have very geometrical shapes, don't expect fancy light or particles effects. More annoying are the many loading times even for small levels. Before AND after each level there is a similar 'lift' sequence, which quickly get repetitive and boring, and only add extra loading times.

- The designers made commendable efforts on the gfx style and story telling. The robotics voice acting are a mix of joke/taunt/background story/hint, however I don't find they were relly funny, but rather annoying. Nevertheless you shouldn't turn the voices off for fear of missing a helpful hint. Overal I wasn't captivated by the atmosphere and the plot, and all the cutscenes was more a distraction than anything else

- There are no manual or tutorial, instead there are some visual and speech hints, but this is the kind of game where understanding the rules and mechanisms is part of the puzzles. Not a big issue, but sometimes a cause for irritation.

- Basically each level is a small closed room where you must open and reach the exit. Rooms are mostly empty, and only contain a very few items relevant to the solution. Indeed the first puzzle are rather easy once you get the idea of the game.
Then in the second third of the game, the levels become larger and more open, and feels like an abandonned factory. This introduce an element of exploration. Unfortunately the environment is completly passive (except for a very obvious levers), and even if you explore every remote corners you won't find anything of interest. In the end you roam long corridors and scaffolders, which only dilute the puzzle solving aspect of the game. And most of this part is pretty linear and boring with many repetitive puzzles, and some dexterity challenges. 

- The final part of the game revert back to the puzzle rooms and is more interesting with some good and challenging puzzle.

- The single player mode took me 11h to complete. There is also a cooperative 2 player mode which is a different experience (of little interest for me as I have a poor connection and play mostly solo). Additionaly there are many users created contents which add to the experience.
Considering the price this is a decent amount of content. But overal I find the game didn't lived up to the hype and there are other puzzle game that I found more enjoyable.

Про эту игру можно сказать ооочень много. Именно с неё начался мой путь в Steam.
Одиночная игра представляет собой тучу головоломок с невероятно крутым, трагичным, красивым, непредсказуемым, классным (и тд) сюжетом!
Сетевая игра не уступает одиночной. Здесь присутствуют свои концовки и свой небольшой сюжетик. Вы можете вновь испытать чувства от прохождения и разделить их с другом!
Также присутствуют тестовые камеры сообщества, которые вы можете сделать сами или скачать из мастерской (и проходить бесконечно).
Если вы любите отличные игры, то вам явно нужно попробовать поиграть в это!
Даже если вы не любитель разгадывать головоломки, то это не причина пропускать такой стоящий продукт.
11/10 - лучшая игра, в которую я когда-либо играл!
This is the 2nd BEST game ever!!!! Only beaten by Half-Life 2

Very nice game - I finished the singleplayer game in ~9 hours, now it's time to complete beautiful and funny co-op campagne!
9/10

Portal 2 is a great game. There really is a lot to love here.
-- User generated content makes for a very attractive extra. If you don't care about it, then no harm done. If you want more puzzles after the story mode, however, then you are covered.
-- Coop is there as its own entity, meaning if you are a solo-gamer like me, then it won't affect your experience. It's also a nice extra that adds something without taking away from anything
-- Gameplay is fresh and the portal mechanic is really fun. No other game really uses this mechanic as a core component of gameplay. 
-- Music is fantastic. Music is something i typically don't notice. Portal, however, is an exception, Every track is memorable and enjoyable. Even the ambiance noise is nice to listen too.
-- Great characters (for what few there are). GLaDOS and Weatley are very memorable characters.


There are a lot of reasons to pick up this game. The game was made by Valve, and shows a level of polish and quality we rarely see today; even years after it's been out, it's still a great game. This game has so few flaws, it's hard to think of anything aside from nitpicking. This game is one of my favorite games, as it is for so many others. Give it a bash: it's cheap, habitually on sale, and inclusive for gamers of any gender or age (within reason. If they can beat a stage in Super Mario, then can probably play this).
Has to be the third or fourth time that I have completed this game, and I will be back for more again. Heartily recommended

A great improvement to Portal 1. Which means this game is really good, because Portal 1 was still very fun.

Portal 1 was mainly fun because it introduced (at least, I haven't heard of any earlier games with this) the concept of shooting two portals to complete levels. You shoot two portals, walk through one, come out the other. It's a fairly simple concept, but it opens all kinds of new puzzles. However, a downside of Portal 1 was that the average gamer would pretty much be done playing it after finishing the campaign, because there wasn't much more to offer. And the campaign wasn't very long.

This is where Portal 2 shines. The main new feature is the level editor, where you can create your own test chambers. And if you aren't very creative with creating test chambers, Steam Workshop has thousands of test chambers created by other users. So you'll probably never run out of puzzles. Also, the campaign is longer, so that is good as well.

In summary, if you enjoyed Portal 1, get this. If you haven't played Portal 1, you should still try it out; maybe get it at a Steam sale since it goes on sale often. You'll probably like Portal 2 no matter what genres you enjoy. 4/5 stars.
